title: Stock market today: Dow explodes 3,000 points higher, S&P 500 has best day since 2008 as Trump pauses most reciprocal tariffs
Brawl involving 20-30 people breaks out at California In-N-Out
US pauses higher tariffs for most countries but hits China harder
description: Trump authorises a "lowered reciprocal tariff of 10%" for most countries, except China, while negotiations continue.

title: US stocks make historic gains after Trump pauses some tariffs
description: But Trump also raises tariffs on goods from China to at least 125% "effective immediately".

title: Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

title: Wall Street's Nasdaq Jumps More Than 10% After Trump's Tariffs Pause
description: Wall Street stocks rocketed to close solidly higher Wednesday, with dramatic advances on all three major indexes as US President Donald Trump delayed steep new tariffs hours after they took effect.

title: Israel Says Seizing "Large Areas" Of Gaza As Strike Kills 23
description: Israel said Wednesday its troops were seizing "large areas" in Gaza and making the Palestinian territory "smaller and more isolated", as an air strike on a residential block killed at least 23 people.

title: Markets Soar After Trump Backs Down on Tariffs
description: The S&P 500 rose 9.5 percent after President Trump announced he would pause his “reciprocal” tariffs for 90 days, but economists warned that American importers were not out of danger.
author: The New York Times

title: Ukrainians Mourn Many Killed in Russian Strike Near Playground
description: A Russian missile strike near a playground in central Ukraine killed 19 people, including nine children. The attack was a painful reminder that a cease-fire remains as distant as ever.
author: Constant Méheut, Evelina Riabenko, Daria Mitiuk and Finbarr O’Reilly

title: Trump temporarily drops tariffs to 10% for most countries, hits China harder with 125%
description: The U.S. stock market, which had suffered since President Trump unveiled his tariff plan, rose sharply after he announced a pause to allow negotiations.

title: Dot-com bust, 1987 crash had massive relief rallies similar to Wednesday's pop
description: The Nasdaq had its second-best day on record on Wednesday, the kind of rally the market only sees during the worst of times.

title: Trump steps back from cliff edge of all-out global trade war - BBC
description: Trump steps back from cliff edge of all-out global trade war  BBCDow surges 2,900 points, S&P 500 posts biggest gain since 2008 on Trump tariff reversal: Live updates  CNBCTrump’s new tariffs could set US-China trade relations back to the Mao era  PoliticoU.S. stocks soar in an incredible rally after Trump pauses many of his tariffs  NPRCongress' Republicans fume as Trump blindsides them with tariff pause  Axios

title: Supreme Court lets Trump remove independent regulators, for now - The Washington Post
description: Supreme Court lets Trump remove independent regulators, for now  The Washington PostSupreme Court says Trump doesn’t have to rehire independent labor board members for now  CNNSupreme Court Chief Justice Roberts swoops in to save Trump firing decision  Fox NewsRoberts temporarily halts lower court orders blocking Trump's firing of independent labor boards' members  CBS NewsSupreme Court allows Trump to fire independent agency members  NBC News

title: US House approves bill to restrict district judges’ nationwide rulings on Trump policies
author: TOI World Desk

title: Judges in Texas and New York halt deportation of Venezuelans under wartime law
author: TOI World Desk

title: UK to co-host global conference with aim of resolving Sudan’s civil war
description: Foreign ministers will gather in London and seek to exert diplomatic pressure demanding a ceasefireThe British government is bringing together foreign ministers from nearly 20 countries and organisations in an attempt to establish a group that can drive the warring factions in Sudan closer towards peace.The conference at Lancaster House in London on 15 April comes on the second anniversary of the start of a civil war that has led to the world’s biggest humanitarian crisis, but has been persistently left at the bottom of the global list of diplomatic priorities. Half of Sudan’s population are judged to be desperately short of food, with 11 million people internally displaced. Continue reading...
author: Patrick Wintour Diplomatic editor

title: Revealed: Big tech’s new datacentres will take water from the world’s driest areas
description: Amazon, Google and Microsoft are building datacentres in water-scarce parts of five continentsAmazon, Microsoft and Google are operating datacentres that use vast amounts of water in some of the world’s driest areas and are building many more, the non-profit investigatory organisation SourceMaterial and the Guardian have found.With Donald Trump pledging to support them, the three technology giants are planning hundreds of datacentres in the US and across the globe, with a potentially huge impact on populations already living with water scarcity. Continue reading...
author: Luke Barratt, Costanza Gambarini and data graphics by Andrew Witherspoon and Aliya Uteuova

title: Singer and ex-MLB players among 124 dead in Santo Domingo nightclub collapse
description: A roof collapse at the Jet Set nightclub in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic, has killed at least 124 and injured more than 155.
author: Mikhail Klimentov, Samantha Schmidt

title: E.U. hits back at U.S. steel levies hours before Trump’s tariff pause
description: The European Union has pursued a phased and relatively restrained response to U.S. tariffs, as its leaders weigh the risk of escalation.
author: Ellen Francis, Beatriz Ríos
